snippet: China’s Xinhua news agency said religious extremists set off a deadly confrontation between the police and ethnic Uighurs in a far-western region.
abstract: Police in China's volatile far-western Xinjiang region say deadly confrontation with members of Uighur ethnic minority was set off by religious extremists who attacked police after one of their group was arrested; Chinese officials have demanded unyielding security response in region.
lead_paragraph: China’s Xinhua news agency said religious extremists set off a deadly confrontation between the police and ethnic Uighurs in a far-western region.

headline.main: Chinese Police Blame Religious Extremists for Violence in Region
headline.print_headline: Chinese Police Blame Religious Extremists for Violence in Region
